Posts.Content: I don't have much experience yet as I only had first chemo yesterday.  I did do some things in prep though;  Had my eyebrows tattooed stocked up on anti hand gel Filled the freezer with meals Bought lots of pineapple as I've heard this helps the horrible mouth Bought a baby toothbrush and toothbrush (again helps with mouth)  invested in some good natural moisturizer, lip balm etc for possible dry skin and I've been lathering that on already!  Got a 1litre water bottle so it is easier for me to see when I have drank the recommended 2 litres.  This might be completely useless but I'm a planner and I like to feel prepared as much as possible!  Good luck x
Posts.Title: tips to reduce side effects before starting chemo, please

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry you find yourself in this situation again. I am very new to this, just had a lumpectomy and axillary node clearance last week so am only at the start of the journey.  It's extremely frightening when you have young children, mine are 1 and 3 and it can all be very over whelming.  I don't really have any words of comfort and just wanted to let you know that you are not in your own. Try and stay positive. Sending you hugs  x
Posts.Title: New lump in other breast

Posts.Content: I tested positive on the first lymph node so they went on to remove 17 and the rest were clear.  I felt better that they had removed them but it's personal choice.  I did not find the op too bad, I came out of hospital the same day and I was back at work within a week and looking ater my 3 and 1 year old alone.  Good luck in your decision xx
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: HI everyone,  I am due to start chemo in a couple of weeks. I wondered after how many chemo sessions did you experience total hair loss?  Also when did you need to start wearing a wig? Could you get away with it until the 2nd or 3rd Chemo or did you need to start wearing it after your first one?  Thank you x
Posts.Title: How many cycles of chemo before total hair loss?

Posts.Content: Tiy  I have just had exactly that done. I had a mastectomy and implant reconstruction on one side and then an uplift and reduction on the other all in the same op. I went from a G to a D.  I'm 3 weeks post op and recovery has been fine, far better and easier than I thought. My boobs also looks great, I'm lacking a nipple on one side but I have two equal perky boobs with minimum scaring. I'm so pleased i had them both done together. Happy to answer any questions you have x
Posts.Title: Reducing the other side?

Posts.Content: thanks all! Given me some things to think about and ask tommorow!
Posts.Title: Questions to ask re: mastectomy

Posts.Content: That is good to know. Thank you.  It is so hard with little ones. How are you finding the chemo with your little ones? x
Posts.Title: Masectomy

Posts.Content: Hi,  I don't really know what I'm after but I just need to chat and hear other people' experiences.  Bit of backstory, had lumpectomy and node removal. Nodes clear but chemo and radiotherapy planned because I'm only 31. Unfortunately didn't get clear margins so had another op. This too has come back unclear and they say the cancer is all gone but there are alot of pre cancerous cells so are now saying i need a mastctomy.  Im just so disheartened and feel so sad at the thought of another op. What is recovery like for a mastectomy with reconstruction? I have a 1 year old and 3 year old and I'm worried about the impact this will have on them.  Thank you in advance
Posts.Title: Masectomy

Posts.Content: Thank you Jen that has put my mind at rest abit. Glad you are finding it all so manageable.  How long did you have to stay in hospital for your op? x
Posts.Title: Masectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for all the info everyone it's all been really useful and has put me at ease a little xx
Posts.Title: Masectomy

Posts.Content: Hi,  I have a meeting tommorow with BCN about my future mastectomy and reconstruction options. What questions should I be asking?  I'm sure that I will think of some when I'm there but I dont want to miss anything important!  Thanks x
Posts.Title: Questions to ask re: mastectomy

Posts.Content: it's such a tough decision to make isn't it.  I was offered chemo as a precaution and decided to do it. They described it as 'mopping up any stray cancer cells around the body that they couldn't see to prevent it coming back in the future" this made my decision for me really.  I wanted to make sure that I had done everything I possibly could to get rid of every trace of cancer. if it came back and I hadn't done chemo I would be so upset with myself and might not be so lucky next time. I have finished chemo 5 weeks ago and it hasn't been too bad at all, got through with very mild side effects.  It's such a personal choice but just wanted to share mine. Good Luck in whatever you decide x
Posts.Title: What to do for the best

Posts.Content: I'm thinking ahead really as currently having chemo but I'm due to have a mastectomy on my left side because of pre cancerous cells in October.  My thoughts are I'd like them to remove both and reconstruct them using implants. I have a couple of reasons for this;  Im quite large busted and feel really worried and stressed that I might not be able to spot a lump on my good boob. I really don't want to live with the stress of it. I know it could come back somewhere else but at least I'm reducing its options!  Secondly, I dont want a huge implant in the first boob so it's a similar size to my other. I would rather just have them done together so they match? Also I suppose I don't necessarily need the second one removed completely just reduced?  Has anyone requested this? Had experience of this?  Are the NHS likely to do this or do I need to look into it privately?
Posts.Title: Double Mastectomy privately?

Posts.Content: Thank you, I will have a chat with my BCN.  It might be I can just have a reduction on the good side I suppose. So many things to think about, I just want as little surgery as possible!
Posts.Title: Double Mastectomy privately?

Posts.Content: Hi Terri,  I had my chemo 9 days ago and I had back ache yesterday too. It seems abit better today so I thought it was maybe related to the injections as i have just stopped doing them.  Hope your feeling better today x
Posts.Title: EC chemo - back pain

Posts.Content: That's great Lucy, well done! You will have to let me know how you get on with the dreaded T! x
Posts.Title: chemo finish line approaching

Posts.Content: So I know I am going to have to start chemo shortly and am so stressed about losing my hair. I'm abit ashamed about this because Its only hair and it will grow but I think I just do not want to look sick all the time.  After abit of googling I found a place called Lucinda Ellery that does kind of permenant wigs that you don't have to take off and your own hair grows underneath. Has anyone had any experience of this?
Posts.Title: Hair Loss-Lucinda Ellary experiences?

Posts.Content: Following this as I'm due to start FEC in a couple of weeks and then Taxotere after.  Im nervous about the whole thing and how awful I'm going to feel but hoping it is all doable.  Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Finished Fec .

Posts.Content: I'm due to get my results from my lumpectomy tommorow and find out how my lymph nodes were effected.  I was just wondering if it is standard that they will send me for CT scan and MRI at some point. Just want to be prepared. it sounds so frightening. :(
Posts.Title: MRI and CT scan

Posts.Content: Thank you for your advice.  No wasn't an underwired bra just a sports bra but maybe it was a bit tight. I won't wear that one again and hope it's all ok.  Hasn't bled anymore this morning and all is looking good, no unusual swelling, temp anything like that so I will ring them tommorow.  Thanks Leolady, it's been a tough old year but feels good to see the light at the end of the tunnel.  xx
Posts.Title: Bleeding after op

Posts.Content: I am due to start next Friday and like you in scared.  But I think the unknown is often worse than the reality. I am trying to think In my head that it's only 6 sessions so really manageble.  I have booked the week after treatment off work, booked in a weekly cleaner, filled the freezer with food, got my wig, sorted childcare and sorted out a chemo bag and now feel I've done all I can to help make things easier.  You can do this unicorn it is such a short time feeling poorly if it gets those nasties and your still alive and kicking in 40 years! if you need to talk feel free to pm me as we are starting at similar time.  Good luck and hugs x
Posts.Title: Terrified of starting chemo

Posts.Content: Hi, Had mastectomy and implant on left side and reduction on right side on Wednesday. Been feeling good and not really in any pain which is good, just abit uncomfy.  Today I wore a different bra and after lunch thought it was hurting abit so went up and changed it. It now looks like it's has been bleeding where my bra sits. Under the boob. I rang the ward and they said that the thick brown waxy dressings that I have are designed to stay on as long as possible so if it's not hurting, bloody coming through the bandage and I'm feeling ok then it should be fine. Had anyone else had experience? I will obviously ring the breast care nurse on Monday. It's not hurting at all but I'm worried I've burst my stitches or something is going wrong beneath those dressings!!
Posts.Title: Bleeding after op

Posts.Content: I am due to start next Friday and like you in scared.  But I think the unknown is often worse than the reality. I am trying to think In my head that it's only 6 sessions so really manageble.  I have booked the week after treatment off work, booked in a weekly cleaner, filled the freezer with food, got my wig, sorted childcare and sorted out a chemo bag and now feel I've done all I can to help make things easier.  You can do this unicorn it is such a short time feeling poorly if it gets those nasties and your still alive and kicking in 40 years! if you need to talk feel free to pm me as we are starting at similar time.  Good luck and hugs x
Posts.Title: Terrified of starting chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah,  You sound in a very similar situation that I was.  I have a 1 year old too!  They told me after my ultrasound that it looked cancerous but couldn't confirm until after biopsy. It did turn out to be cancerous and was actually a very similar size to yours, I also had one lymph node that was cancerous but all the rest were clear. I'm in the middle of treatment at the moment after my op and it's all been manageable and hasn't stopped me doing things with my children and leading a normal family life. I hope your results are clear but if not and you need any advice feel free to message me.xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results - breast cancer

Posts.Content: I'm following this post as this is exactly what I want to talk to my BCN about tommorow! x
Posts.Title: Advice on reconstructive surgery and reduction of good breast

Posts.Content: I had my meeting with The BCN today initially she said that they would do it bit not all in one op and at a later date. However when I expressed a number if reasons for it to be done at the same time she said that if spoke to the surgeon that she would most probably do it. I think it's at the discretion of the surgeon and if you argue your case they are more likely to do it x
Posts.Title: Advice on reconstructive surgery and reduction of good breast

Posts.Content: That is exactly how I feel and I would rather do all I can now to avoid it coming back in a few years to come. I have a 3 year old and a 1 year so whilst more children would have been nice i feel so lucky that I don't have to think about that.  fingers crossed it' just the 6 rounds as that seems standard! thanks for all your advice x
Posts.Title: 6 or 8 cycles

Posts.Content: Hi,  I'm just about to have my last FEC on Friday and have been really lucky to get away with just abit of tiredness throughout.  I have read abit about how T is so much harder than FEC and to be honest I'm terrified. Any one got any tips on how I can make it any easier? what side effects should I expect? How did you find it in comparison to the FEC.  Thank you in advance x
Posts.Title: Taxotore

Posts.Content: I've had surgery to remove at grade 2, 2cm tumor. I had full node clearance and all nodes were clear apart from first sentile node. I'm currently waiting for my oncology appointment on the 23rd.  initially my BCN said 6 rounds of chemo then the next time I spoke to her she said 6 or 8. I just wondered how they decide between the 6 or 8? As they said it was really just a precaution because off my age I am really hoping it' the 6!  Thanks in advance, so much waiting around! I'm ready to start this now! sooner it' started the sooner it's finished! x
Posts.Title: 6 or 8 cycles

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for all the info everyone it' is really useful and gives me some good questions to ask at my oncology app.  Yes it's hormone positive and HER-. All they said is that as I am only 31 they would do chemo and as they like to throw everything at it to give it the best possible chance of it not coming back.  I will look into the oncotype test though as obviously if I could avoid it that would be better!  With regards to my full lymph node removal, when they did lumpectomy they test your first sentile node, if that comes back positive they remove them all. After my op and testing they all came back clear thank goodness x
Posts.Title: 6 or 8 cycles

Posts.Content: Hi Lucy,  im glad to hear that you have managed well this week. I have my first session next Friday so it's good to read stories and experiences like yours.  your doing great, only 5 more to go!!! you have so got this xx
Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: I am continuing to work in a childcare environment during my chemo. my oncologist was fine with it as long as I was careful and listened to my body x
Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: Hi Lucy,  im glad to hear that you have managed well this week. I have my first session next Friday so it's good to read stories and experiences like yours.  your doing great, only 5 more to go!!! you have so got this xx
Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: I am continuing to work in a childcare environment during my chemo. my oncologist was fine with it as long as I was careful and listened to my body x
Posts.Title: Through first week of 1st Cyle of fec-t

Posts.Content: Thank you for the info, I have a 1 year old and 3 year old and this is really useful to know x
Posts.Title: Chickenpox and chemo

Posts.Content: That doesn't sound right. It's normally when you are all healed up properly. I had my op at the end of October and am just finishing radiotherapy. It would have been earlier but I asked for a delay as I didn't want to be doing it over Christmas x
Posts.Title: Timescales for rads

Posts.Content: Had Dotexal on Friday, have been feeling pretty rough with oral thrush and things.  Today I have had blister like lumps appear on my chest, there are about 5 of them at the moment. Has anyone else had this? Not sure if this is normal or soemthing I need to be worried about and ringing them for. They aren't really bothering me unless I touch them and then they are itchy.  Thanks in advance again!!!
Posts.Title: Blisters after Dotexal

Posts.Content: Dizzy I get my results tommorow.  Such a horrible feeling all this waiting. I hope that it goes well for you.  will be thinking of you xx
Posts.Title: After operation

Posts.Content: How did you get on Dizzy? xx
Posts.Title: After operation

Posts.Content: Hi Dizzy,  Sorry to hear the results weren't what you hoped. I kmow how stressful that waiting can be, I had full node clearance during my lumectomy as my sentile node came up positive for cancer cells. However after testing them all it was only that one. I guess I'm trying to say that it might not be as bad as you think.  The clearance is abit more painful than the lumpectomy and takes about longer to recover but I was back after work and looking after the kids after a week.  I'm back on the 1st of May for my second clearance. Keeping my fingers crossed that it's successful.  I'm here if you need a chat xx
Posts.Title: After operation

Posts.Content: Going back in on about 3 weeks I think. i feel fine about that, I had the axillary node clearance last time and that's been the painful part. for the lumpectomy they went through my nipple and I wouldn't have even known that it had been done so I feel fine that I need to go back in.  Like you I was more worried about my lymph nodes as they tested one when I was under and because it came back positive they removed 17 more. I feel so lucky they all came back clear and that it is still only grade 2. How long do you have to wait for results on 3rd lymph node? Are they going to remove any more.  I'm ready to start the chemo asap, I figure the sooner it starts the sooner it's finished x
Posts.Title: After operation

Posts.Content: Sorry it's more waiting Dizzy, that's really frustrating for you.  I will have my op first week of May and start chemo probably 3rd week of May so similar time to you I think.  I have my fingers crossed for you xx
Posts.Title: After operation

Posts.Content: Hi,  I didn't get clear margins so got to go back in but my lymph nodes were clear and it's hormone receptive so fairly positive. I will be having chemo and radiotherapy too but I already knew that.  how are you feeling about it All? xx
Posts.Title: After operation
